abstracts.cdata!:
The Copperbelt Environment Project will
            address the environmental liabilities associated with the
            mining sector, following the privatization of the mining
            assets. However, in order to fully attain its objectives, of
            protecting the public health, and safety of local
            communities, prevent or reduce environmental degradation,
            and allow a productive re-use of the land, either to its
            pre-mining use, or an acceptable alternative as applicable,
            land acquisition, and therefore relocation, will occur. This
            Resettlement Action Plan sets the principles for social
            impact mitigation, as regards compensation for loss of
            property, livelihood, and resettlement related issues.
            Compensation for loss of, and access to land will be in the
            form of land for land compensation, at replacement costs to
            project affected peoples (PAPs). Economically marginalized
            PAPs, with reduced access to land, will be provided with
            land in order to enhance their living conditions. Housing
            will be provided, improved, or at least restored, with
            appropriate access to sources of water. Property assets,
            crops, and tree losses will be paid at market value
            determined by, and agreed with Government Valuation.
            Monitoring criteria, and grievance mechanisms will ensure an
            appropriate resettlement process, and resolve potential
            conflicts should they occur.
